data.title: GREAT Shanghai dumplings
data.text:
This place is as big as your nose. It's definitely NOT good for large parties. They don't take reservations so either go early or late or order to go.

The Shanghai dumplings are the best in town--the only in town. They make really good other dumplings--pork, chicken, vegetarian. The fried tofu is good, too.

You're not going for friendly service, just great dumplings. Remember.

data.title: Excellent dinner- We will return!
data.text: We saw this on trip advisor and thought we would try it.  The place was packed, which is always a good sign.  The owner was very friendly, food was all excellent.  We had pork and chive dumplings, Asian pancake with chives, cucumber salad with crushed garlic and five spice beef.  All was excellent and the bill was 27 dollars, including my diet coke.  The sauces were great.  Can't wait to return soon!

data.title: Horrible dirty place
data.text: The food is one of the worst Chinese food ever.  The waiter touched the tips of the forks and tried to give it to me three times.  The flooring is dirty.  The fork and bowels they provided had left over residual food!!!  It is very dirty there. The street parking is not free.

data.title: Great dumplings Authentic hole in the wall
data.text: Stick to the dumplings, you can not go wrong.  The taste and texture are superb.  The mofu tofu was excellent.  I will definitely return to try other dishes.

data.title: Good pork dumplings
data.text: I have eaten beef noodle soup and pork dumplings here and they are both good. The skin isn't too thick and they are made on site under threat owners supervision.  The owner is very friendly and welcoming.

data.title: Best for dumplings
data.text:
Small but popular Chinese place in RWC.  I enjoyed the dumplings and dim sum, they do that just right. I was a bit disappointed in the noodle soup; they had nice long authentic style noodles but the pork and tofu was flavorless and dull.  when I go back I think I will stay focused on the dumplings, that was the real stand out here.

Gets very crowded around lunch time.

data.title: Classic "hole-in-the-wall" find
data.text:
This is the stereotypical hole-in-the-wall dumpling (dim sum) restaurant. 

They honestly have one of the best dumplings i've had in the south bay. Their Xiaolongbao (shanghai soup dumpling) is outstanding. 

Their owner is a really funny guy, and they honestly seem like they put a lot of effort into their food. They are pretty recent immigrants from China, and most of the food is very authentic. 

Keep in mind that this store specializes in dumplings, so please don't waste the opportunity to try some serious authentic Chinese dumplings by ordering some beef and broccoli.

data.title: Great food and service!
data.text:
Wonderful dumpling hole in the wall.  Highly recommend the Shanghai dumplings and spicy beef tendon.

Place is small so you may have to wait, but it's definitely worth it.  Service is excellent and friendly!

data.title: Authentic Chinese including Service
data.text: The Service here is bad, but it's a real Chinese restaurant, so you shouldn't expect US-style service (even if it is in the US). The lamb dumplings were excellent and just like the ones I have had on trips to China. They rival those I have had in other cities with large Chinese populations, including Vancouver and Toronto. Some of the vegetable dishes have a ton of garlic (also authentic and tasty), so couples on blind dates beware. I love the setting too because it reminds me of a few tiny spots I found in Hutong in Beijing. I will come back.

data.title: Ask for the dumplings - it's a dumpling house
data.text: This is not a fancy restaurant, but it is clean and the service is good and most important the dumplings are very good ... maybe excellent. The other dishes are nice and worth trying, but if you only order one item make it a dumpling.

data.title: Very Tasty!
data.text: This place is a tiny hole-in-the-wall, but it is always filled with happy diners.  On our first visit, we tried to order a variety of things, and everything was delicious.  The scallion pancakes were especially good, but all the dumplings we ordered were great too.  I look forward to going back soon to try some of the other things we couldn't squeeze in on our first visit.

data.title: infintesimal hole in the wall - great food
data.text: This place has only 8 tables and they're all formica. You can see through a window into the kitchen, where there's an elderly guy holding down the entire places. Trust the owners and waitstaff to steer you toward the better dishes. It's an authentic chinese experience, and for very few bucks you will feel like you're in a back alley place in beijing, but you won't want to linger too long - it's welcoming but not a hang out. Good for a traveller looking for a very authentic chinese experience.

data.title: Outstanding!!
data.text:
We have had lunch at iDumpling a couple of times over the past few months.
Food: Outstanding! Everything we have tried has been fresh, well prepared and very flavorful. We love the pork and chive dumplings, the lamb dumplings, the Shangai noodles (our favorite), the garlic and cucumber salad ( a must have) and some other dishes. The prices are extremely cheap and the portion sizes large.
Ambiance: OK. It is very small place. The decor is Ok but the food makes up for everything.
service: the service can be mixed. If they are busy they can be rude, but when they are not busy or after being seated they are nothing but nice and polite, ever ready to make your dining experience wonderful.
Overall, our favorite place for authentic Chinese food in the area.

data.title: Great Chinese dumplings
data.text: First time here but the dumplings were as good as I get in shanghai . And the price was excellent . Not a fancy place but good service and the cooks really cared what we thought about their food .  I will be going back many more times and would recommend this to any one .

data.title: 平價的餃子店
data.text: 雖然餃子非常小，但是不難吃，價格也不貴。此外也有供應「台式簡餐」，有一個主菜、數道小菜與白飯，也是可以小錢吃到飽的好選擇。
